com.camerontec.catalys.core.session

Class MessageAssembler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.MessageAssembler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public final class MessageAssembler
extends Object
implements Runnable
    This class provides the thread which listens to an input stream and assembles IFIXMessages from the incoming bytes.

    The message assembly thread may not be restarted once it is stopped.

    See Also:
    IFIXMessageFactory, IFIXMessage

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageAssembler

        public MessageAssembler(IFIXMessageReader messageReader,
                        IFIXMessageFactory messageFactory,
                        Session session,
                        CPULockFactory cpuLockFactory)
        Create MessageAssembler associated with given message reader and factory.
        Parameters:
        messageReader - Object use to read messages from an input stream. Must not be null.
        messageFactory - The factory to use when creating message objects. Must not be null.
        session - The session to which assembled messages are delivered. This may be null in which case all Observers of this class are notified.
        cpuLockFactory - CPU lock factory from which a lock will be created.

      • MessageAssembler

        public MessageAssembler(IFIXMessageReader messageReader,
                        IFIXMessageFactory messageFactory,
                        Session session,
                        CPULockFactory cpuLockFactory,
                        int maximumInboundMessageRate)
        Create MessageAssembler associated with given message reader and factory.
        Parameters:
        messageReader - Object use to read messages from an input stream. Must not be null.
        messageFactory - The factory to use when creating message objects. Must not be null.
        session - The session to which assembled messages are delivered. This may be null in which case all Observers of this class are notified.
        cpuLockFactory - CPU lock factory from which a lock will be created.
        maximumInboundMessageRate - Inbound throttling rate in messages per second. Values below 1 will disable throttling.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String threadName)
        Start processing the input stream.

        This method is designed to be called once only. If it is called twice an Exception will be thrown.

        These constraints may seem unnecessarily restrictive, however, this class is designed to be used in close association with a single Session object only. That is, it is not designed for general use by application level components.

        Parameters:
        threadName - name of the message assembler thread
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called more than once.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the Message Assembler thread. Any resources will be closed.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • setMessageFactory

        public void setMessageFactory(IFIXMessageFactory messageFactory)
        The message factory can change in a server environment where the MessageAssembler has to be created with a default message factory in order to read the very first message (normally Logon). Up to this point, we still do not know who (ie which connectionPoint) the incoming message is from - so we cannot pick up the correct configured message factory. Once we have the first message, we can pick up the correct configuration and set the associated message factory - which has to be passed down to the message assembler. That comes in here.
        Parameters:
        messageFactory - Message factory to be used by message assembler for creating messages.

      • getReader

        public IFIXMessageReader getReader()
        Get the IFixMessageReader used to read FIX messages from input stream.
        Returns:
        IFixMessageReader used to read FIX messages from input stream.

      • setReader

        public void setReader(IFIXMessageReader reader,
                      boolean allowChangeOnLiveConnection)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Set the IFIXMessageReader used to read FIX messages from input stream.

        If this has not been called, a default reader is created.

        Parameters:
        reader - Object used to read incoming FIX messages
        allowChangeOnLiveConnection - If true, it is possible to change readers on a live connection. This is clearly dangerous and should not normally be done.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if allowChangeOnLiveConnection is false and the message assembler has already been started

      • setMaximumInboundMessageRate

        public void setMaximumInboundMessageRate(int maximumInboundMessageRate)
        Set the maximum inbound message rate and enable throttling.
        Parameters:
        maximumInboundMessageRate - The rate in messages per second. Values less than 1 will disable throttling.
